chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
Y: Type
S: X -> Y -> Prop
R: X -> Y -> Prop
ll: list X
mm: list Y

Goal:
Forall2 (fun (x : X) (y : Y) => R x y /\ S x y) ll mm <-> Forall2 R ll mm /\ Forall2 S ll mm

Premises:
Forall2 : forall A B : Type, (A -> B -> Prop) -> list A -> list B -> Prop
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Forall2_map_right : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R : Y -> X -> Prop) (f : Z -> X) (mm : list Y) (ll : list Z), Forall2 R mm (map f ll) < -> Forall2 (fun (y : Y) (x : Z) => R y (f x)) mm ll
Forall2_map_left : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R : Y -> X -> Prop) (f : Z -> Y) (ll : list Z) (mm : list X), Forall2 R (map f ll) mm < -> Forall2 (fun (x : Z) (y : X) => R (f x) y) ll mm
Forall2_mono : forall (X Y : Type) (R S : X -> Y -> Prop), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), R x y -> S x y) -> forall (l : list X) (m : list Y), Forall2 R l m -> Forall2 S l m
Forall2_cons_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (a : X) (ll : list X) (mm : list Y), Forall2 R (a :: ll) mm -> {b : Y & {mm' : list Y | R a b /\ mm = b :: mm' /\ Forall2 R ll mm'}}
Forall2_map_both : forall (X Y X' Y' : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (f : X' -> X) (g : Y' -> Y) (ll : list X') (mm : list Y'), Forall2 R (map f ll) (map g mm) < -> Forall2 (fun (x : X') (y : Y') => R (f x) (g y)) ll mm
Forall2_Forall : forall (X : Type) (R : X -> X -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall2 R ll ll < -> Forall (fun x : X => R x x) ll
Forall2_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (x : X) (l : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: m) < -> R x y /\ Forall2 R l m
list_exists : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l : list X), (forall x : X, In x l -> exists y : Y, R x y) -> exists ll : list Y, Forall2 R l ll
Forall2_cons_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (b : Y) (ll : list X) (mm : list Y), Forall2 R ll (b :: mm) -> {a : X & {ll' : list X | R a b /\ ll = a :: ll' /\ Forall2 R ll' mm}}
Forall_app : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (ll mm : list X), Forall P (ll ++ mm) < -> Forall P ll /\ Forall P mm
Forall2_app_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l : list X) (m1 m2 : list Y), Forall2 R l (m1 ++ m2) -> {l1 : list X & {l2 : list X | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ l = l1 ++ l2}}
Forall2_app_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list X) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (l1 ++ l2) m -> {m1 : list Y & {m2 : list Y | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ m = m1 ++ m2}}
Forall2_cons : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l')
Forall_cons_inv : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (x : X) (ll : list X), Forall P (x :: ll) < -> P x /\ Forall P ll
Forall2_ind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
Forall2_sind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> SProp), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
Forall2_nil_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (m : list X), Forall2 R m nil -> m = nil
Forall2_nil_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (m : list Y), Forall2 R nil m -> m = nil
List.Forall2_app_inv_l : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A) (l' : list B), Forall2 R (l1 ++ l2) l' -> exists l1' l2' : list B, Forall2 R l1 l1' /\ Forall2 R l2 l2' /\ l' = l1' ++ l2'
List.Forall2_app_inv_r : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (l1' l2' : list B) (l : list A), Forall2 R l (l1' ++ l2') -> exists l1 l2 : list A, Forall2 R l1 l1' /\ Forall2 R l2 l2' /\ l = l1 ++ l2
Forall2_app : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A) (l1' l2' : list B), Forall2 R l1 l1' -> Forall2 R l2 l2' -> Forall2 R (l1 ++ l2) (l1' ++ l2')
Tauto.eval_cnf_app : forall (Env Term' Annot : Type) (eval' : Env -> Term' -> Prop) (env : Env) (x y : list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot)), Tauto.eval_cnf eval' env (rev_append x y) < -> Tauto.eval_cnf eval' env x /\ Tauto.eval_cnf eval' env y
Record ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_rt { Radd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; Radd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); Radd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); Rmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; Rmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); Rmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); Rdistr_l : forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd x y) z) (radd (rmul x z) (rmul y z...
in_prod : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), In x l -> In y l' -> In (x, y) (list_prod l l')
in_prod_iff : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), In (x, y) (list_prod l l') < -> In x l /\ In y l'
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), In y (map f l) < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ In x l)
Forall2_nil : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop), Forall2 R nil nil
Forall2_refl : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop), Forall2 R nil nil
Permutation_Forall2 : forall (A B : Type) (P : A -> B -> Prop) (l1 l1' : list A) (l2 : list B), l1 ~p l1' -> Forall2 P l1 l2 -> exists l2' : list B, l2 ~p l2' /\ Forall2 P l1' l2'
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), In x (filter f l) < -> In x l /\ f x = true
Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
FinFun.Injective = fun (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) => forall x y : A, f x = f y -> x = y : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.Injective {A B}%type_scope _%function_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.divide = fun x y : BinNums.Z => exists z : BinNums.Z, y = BinInt.Z.mul z x : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
perm_swap : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l

split.
